Spec.jl

    Docstrings
    Spec.@invariant — Macro.

    Define invariant - currently a dummy for documenation

    Spec.@post — Macro.

    Define a postcondition on function argument.

    Currently @post works similarly to @assert except that:

    1. an exception is thrown
    2. postcheckons can be disabled
    julia> f(x::Real) = (@post x > 0; sqrt(x) + 5)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(-3)
ERROR: ArgumentError: x > 0
    Spec.@pre — Macro.

    Define a precondition on function argument. Currently @pre works similarly to @assert except that:

    1. an exception is thrown
    2. precheckons can be disabled
    julia> f(x::Real) = (@pre x > 0; sqrt(x) + 5)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(-3)
ERROR: ArgumentError: x > 0

    Pre with a comment

    FIXME: redundancy

    Spec.@spec — Macro.

    @Spec [tags...] [methodspecifier] clause1 [clause2 ... clausen] [comment]

    Define an invariant that should be true

    A spec may access

    • Special meta characters

    – _res: The return value – _a1, _a2, _an: The value of the 1st, 2nd, nth argument

    Tags

    • :nocheck - Never check this specification
    • :incomplete - Indicates that spec is incomplete
    Spec.@with_pre — Macro.

    Activate precondition checking within scope of expr

    julia> f(x::Real) = (@pre x > 0; sqrt(x) + 5)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(-3)
ERROR: DomainError:
Stacktrace:
 [1] f(::Int64) at ./REPL[2]:1

julia> @with_pre begin
               f(-3)
             end
ERROR: ArgumentError: x > 0
Stacktrace:
    Spec.MethodSpec
    Spec.PRE_CHECKING_ON

    Predicate indicates if prop of m is c - m::Method -> m.prop = c

    Predicate indicates pred(prop) of is true - m::Method -> m.prop = c

    Spec.newestmethod — Function.

    Most recently created method of generic function func

    Spec.spectable
    Spec.walktests — Function.

    Walk through test_dir directory and execute all tests, excluding exclude

    julia> using Spec
julia> walktests(Spec)
    Spec.with_pre — Function.

    Macroless version of @with_pre

    julia> f(x::Real) = (@pre x > 0; sqrt(x) + 5)
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(-3)
ERROR: DomainError:
Stacktrace:
 [1] f(::Int64) at ./REPL[2]:1

julia> with_pre() do
         f(-3)
       end
ERROR: ArgumentError: x > 0
